## Data Science Ethics Conundrum
A water utility has collected a lot of information about their customers and their water consumption. Climate change severely impacts the water utility's ability to meet the needs of customers and they have implemented legally enforceable water restrictions. A data scientists develops a proposal to use digital metering data to catch people who breach restrictions. 

You are on the Board of this water utility. Do you accept the proposal?

Write your responses on the [Miro Board](https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVOy5M3nM=/)

## Exploratory Analysis
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.width=6, fig.height=4}
library(tidyverse)
library(datasauRus)

filter(datasaurus_dozen, dataset != "slant_up") %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y)) +
    geom_point(col = "dodgerblue4") +
    theme_void(base_size = 12) +
    theme(legend.position = "none") +
    facet_wrap(~dataset, ncol = 6)
```

## R Code
```{r echo=TRUE}
library(readr)
library(dplyr)

labdata <- readr::read_csv("data/labdata.csv")

group_by(labdata, Measure) %>% 
    summarise(min = min(Result),
              mean = mean(Result),
              sd = sd(Result))
```

## Python Code
```{python echo=TRUE}
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np 

labdata = pd.read_csv('data/labdata.csv')
 
labdata.groupby("Measure")["Result"].agg([np.min, np.mean, np.std])
```

## Demo 1
<div class="cols">
$$Q = \frac{2}{3} C_d \sqrt{2g} \; bh^\frac{3}{2}$$

- $Q$: Discharge
- $C_d$: Discharge coefficient
- $g$: Acceleration of gravity
- $b$: Crest length
- $h$: Head above crest level
</div>
<div class="cols">
![](images/rectangular-weir.png)

- $b=0.5$ m
- $h=0.1$ m
- $C_d=0.6$
- $g=9.81$ m/s^2^
</div>
